Dialogue: All the same, I'm concerned about Mr. Knox's safety.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Vivian just came over to run through some numbers for the IPO.

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: Please, take a seat. I'm almost finished.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: I'm not much for games.

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: Pity.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Sorry Dylan. I knew this moment would come sooner or later. I was just hoping for later.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: All this time, we thought Red Star was behind this, but it was you.  You faked your kidnapping.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: To gain your trust. And get your help.  I want you to know, my personal attraction to you was a sincere and unrelated complication.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Oh, well, in that case I feel a lot better about you being a lying pole smoker.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Why not? You trust Charlie and you've never even met him.

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: Oh, shut up.

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: She can't have survived.   It's too far.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: We've got more important things to do.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: I can't believe Knox tried to kill me. I mean, I've been lied to, I've been cheated on, but no guy has ever tried to SHOOT me before.  I'm gonna get him for that.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He played us from the very start. It was all just so he could get us to tap into Red Star. He couldn't figure out a way to do it himself.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Who knew that we are actually tapping into the main servers for The National Security Agency?

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: And now, thanks to us, he's had hours to download whatever top secret information he wants, for God knows what reason.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: That laptop was the only way to access the transmitter. And we gave the laptop to...

Speaker: angels
Dialogue: Bosley!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Come on, Bosley, answer.  I've tried all his numbers and paged him five times. No answer.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: I don't even want to think about what I'm thinking right now.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Don't!  He's alive, he's gotta be.   If...  What IS that?

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: I know you can't answer, but... I really hope you can hear this.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Can we trace him?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Not off a boosted signal. We'd have to be within 20 miles.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Come on, Bosley. Tell us where you are.

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: I don't know where I am, really. I'm in a round room. The walls are white. Well. Not white-white. More of a cream, or an eggshell. Vanilla. Yes, I'm going to say vanilla.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Bingo.

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: I don't know which ocean. I was blindfolded the whole time. We were flying. It must've been three or four hours. Maybe more.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: He could be anywhere in North America.

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: Wherever it is, they have really good pudding.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: What, pudding?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Hear that? That's a blue spotted egret. They only live in one place.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Florida.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Our access was cut off at the source.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: GODDAMNIT!

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: But not before we retrieved the information you wanted.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Finally.  How about Bosley? Did we get the information we wanted?

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Once we we drugged him, he sang like a bird.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Hmmm. Miami Arena.    Preparations have been made?

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Yes.    We move out tonight.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Excellent.  Where IS Bosley?

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: In the tower. We were waiting till you gave the word.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well?    No time like the present.

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: Sir?    You should take a look at this.

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: It's not moving.  Oh, this is the oldest one in the book. Punch up camera three.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Oh yeah? And I suppose you could do better?

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Yeah, I sure as hell could.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Oh, right.

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: How about an underwater entry? Or hang gliding over the main tower? There's a million good ways in, if you just do your homework.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You heard the man.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Nice work, Dyl.

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Present for you, sir.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Dylan, how nice. Welcome to my Florida home. Not as tasteful as the one in LA, but much more private.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: So tell me, Knox, what's the brilliant plan? You gonna sell a list of our foreign spies to the highest bidder? Blackmail the President?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: The first plan is too complicated, and the second is virtually impossible.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Revenge?   Against who?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: You know what? I'm not in a gabby mood right now. I've got a score to settle.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Seems like you're going a bit overboard.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: No, just leaving myself plenty of margin for error. Goodbye, Dylan.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: I don't know why you bother.   I've already won.

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Is that so?

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first.  It's gonna be the guy behind me.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised.  Last, you guys -- hell, I'll make something up. We'll have fun.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: You won't even be here. I mean, I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but you should've killed me by now. Because I already know that your people are onto my people, which means any moment now you're going to be called out to go and deal --

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Bosley's close.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You find him.    I'll get Dylan.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: BOSLEY! Bosley, can you hear me?

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: Natalie!   Is that you?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: How do I get up to you?

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: There's a staircase. Look for a switch.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Hello?... Pete, hi! How are you?

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: I'm good. I just -- you said you wanted me to call.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: I did. I do.    I mean, thank you for calling.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: I'm not an insecure person or anything, and I've really enjoyed the very brief time we have spent together.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Can you hold on a sec?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: No.   Not at all.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: You just sound distracted.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: You know, work this week has been really busy. It's been hard to focus.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: Natalie, what was that?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Everything's fine!

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: Hate to disagree.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: No, it's Pete.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: You bitch!   I like that guy.

Speaker: vivian wu
Dialogue: To be honest?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: I can handle villainy. I can even handle super-villainy.  But what you did is just wrong.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: Oh my God, let me help you.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Let's GO!

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Don't worry, we'll get him.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: You don't understand. He's got a pound of C-5 in that briefcase.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The question is, where's he headed?

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Not that I don't believe you, but how exactly do you know all this?

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: Because Angels, I was the one who purchased those tickets.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: But Bosley, you HATE sports, why would you...  You didn't buy them for yourself.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You bought them for...

Speaker: angels
Dialogue: CHARLIE!

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: What do you think he looks like?

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: I always saw him as younger.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Definitely.   With black hair.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: No, silver hair. And tan.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He's not George Hamilton.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: He's outside a lot.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: We'll know him when we see him, that's for sure.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: IF we see him.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: How hard can it be to spot Charlie?

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Aw, shit.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'll take the luxury boxes.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: I'll take the mezzanine.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: I got the floor.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Yes, yes!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Charlie!? Charles Townsend!

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Alex?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Jason?  Shit.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: ALEX!    Hey...

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Charlie! Charlie!

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Charlie?

Speaker: likely candidate
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Charles Townsend? Anybody, Charles Townsend?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Jason, hi, I...

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: No you can talk to me NOW. I want to know what the hell is going on. First, you disappear with no explanation, not even a goodbye.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I...

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Now, I see you here, but you're with some other guy.

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Hey, movie star, do yourself a favor and get lost.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Lemme guess.   You must be Charlie?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Jason, please...

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: That was stupid.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Jason, get down!

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Right now, just by leaning forward, I could crush your windpipe. You'd die a slow and painful death. You don't want that, do you?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Hi, Jason.   Gimme one second?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I lied to you Jason.    I'm not a secretary.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Yeah, I can see that.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: And that wasn't Charlie.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm actually here to stop a madman from killing everyone in this building. Would it be okay if we talked later?

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Go save the world, honey.  I'll be waiting for you.

Speaker: referee
Dialogue: Time out!

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Alright, Dylan, all we have to do is figure out which wire to cut.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You're kidding me.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Chartreuse and magenta.   This has gotta be it.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: It's gonna blow anyway, once the clock gets to zero.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Who told you that, my idiotic henchman? Do you think I tell him ANYTHING that's confidential?

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Yeah, I fall for assholes, and you ARE one.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Good one.  Well, I must be going. If you like your body parts attached to your torso, I suggest you do the same.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Give it up, Knox. You're surrounded.

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Give us the detonator.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Charlie?

Speaker: angels
Dialogue: Charlie?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Your father was a double agent, Eric. Yes, I revealed him, but he was killed by his own people before we could throw him in jail.  He was my friend.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: It's still your fault, you arrogant prick! You still killed my father!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Maybe. Maybe I did. But why should YOU kill all these people? If you hate me so much, just shoot ME. Just shoot me, Eric.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Okay.  You're right.  I'll just kill you.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Charlie, no.   NO!

Speaker: natalie
Dialogue: Bosley!   Are you okay?

Speaker: bosley
Dialogue: Think so.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Hey, wait a second. If Bosley's here... then where's Charlie?

Speaker: charlie's voice
Dialogue: Great work, angels. You'll be happy to know you received another presidential commendation.

Speaker: the angels
Dialogue: Thank you Charlie.

Speaker: charlie's voice
Dialogue: Alex, Natalie -- I know you've been putting in some long hours on this case, so I thought you might enjoy a chance to catch up with some old friends.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: Any chance you'll be joining us, Charlie?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I'd love to, Angels. But I have some precious treasures to watch over.

Speaker: dylan
Dialogue: To Charlie.
